alert.note: Alert for Rockingham; Strafford (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 11:05AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Maine, including the following county, York. Portions of New Hampshire, including the following counties, Rockingham and Strafford. * WHEN...Until 130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1105 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Rainfall rates may approach 2 to 3 inches per hour with this band of rain. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Portsmouth, Hampton, Durham, Exeter, Kittery, Dover, Brentwood, Greenland, Stratham and Rye.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
